body_html: Just curious what is our strategy regarding nn functions in ATen. They're not part of the torch namespace (for a good reason), and I think it would be clearer to have a at::nn namespace (or even using F = at::nn::functional) where they would live. Is the plan to just temporarily add them to the main namespace and only move them later? Or do we want at:: to expose this huuuuuuuuge set of functions?
body_text: Just curious what is our strategy regarding nn functions in ATen. They're not part of the torch namespace (for a good reason), and I think it would be clearer to have a at::nn namespace (or even using F = at::nn::functional) where they would live. Is the plan to just temporarily add them to the main namespace and only move them later? Or do we want at:: to expose this huuuuuuuuge set of functions?
body: Just curious what is our strategy regarding nn functions in ATen. They're not part of the `torch` namespace (for a good reason), and I think it would be clearer to have a `at::nn` namespace (or even `using F = at::nn::functional`) where they would live. Is the plan to just temporarily add them to the main namespace and only move them later? Or do we want `at::` to expose this huuuuuuuuge set of functions?
